description:
A how-to course for talented aspiring writers--how to write well in the real world; how to hook the reader and sustain interest; how to develop the journalistic skills that enable a writer to gather and sift and report information. The instructor will share his own real-world experience, as a full-time working journalist for the past three decades. He will be joined on occasion by eminent jourlaists--including several star journalists from the New York Times--who will address the class and appear at mandatory forums to be held at Kelly Writers House. 

See the English Department's website at www.english.upenn.edu for a description of the current offerings.
name: ADV JOURNALISTIC WRITING: GLOBAL JOURNALISM
